ActiveSetUpdate.description: Specification on how the active set should be updated.

entry_gateways.description: The expected number of nodes assigned entry gateway role (i.e. [`Role::EntryGateway`])

exit_gateways.description: The expected number of nodes assigned exit gateway role (i.e. [`Role::ExitGateway`])

mixnodes.description: The expected number of nodes assigned the 'mixnode' role, i.e. total of [`Role::Layer1`], [`Role::Layer2`] and [`Role::Layer3`].

Addr.description:
A human readable address.

In Cosmos, this is typically bech32 encoded. But for multi-chain smart contracts no assumptions should be made other than being UTF-8 encoded and of reasonable length.

This type represents a validated address. It can be created in the following ways 1. Use `Addr::unchecked(input)` 2. Use `let checked: Addr = deps.api.addr_validate(input)?` 3. Use `let checked: Addr = deps.api.addr_humanize(canonical_addr)?` 4. Deserialize from JSON. This must only be done from JSON that was validated before such as a contract's state. `Addr` must not be used in messages sent by the user because this would result in unvalidated instances.

This type is immutable. If you really need to mutate it (Really? Are you sure?), create a mutable copy using `let mut mutable = Addr::to_string()` and operate on that `String` instance.

PendingEpochEventData.description: Details of a particular pending epoch event.

created_at.description: The block height at which the request has been made.

kind.description: The underlying event data, containing its concrete type and information on how it should get resolved.

PendingEpochEventKind.description: Enum encompassing all possible epoch events.

oneOf.description: Request to create a delegation towards particular node. Note that if such delegation already exists, it will get updated with the provided token amount.

amount.description: The amount of tokens to use for the delegation.

node_id.description: The id of the node used for the delegation.

owner.description: The address of the owner of the delegation.

proxy.description: Entity who made the delegation on behalf of the owner. If present, it's most likely the address of the vesting contract.

oneOf.description: Request to remove delegation from particular node.

node_id.description: The id of the node used for the delegation.

owner.description: The address of the owner of the delegation.

proxy.description: Entity who made the delegation on behalf of the owner. If present, it's most likely the address of the vesting contract.

oneOf.description: Request to pledge more tokens (by the node operator) towards its node.

amount.description: The amount of additional tokens to use in the pledge.

node_id.description: The id of the nym node that will have its pledge updated.

oneOf.description: Request to pledge more tokens (by the node operator) towards its node.

amount.description: The amount of additional tokens to use in the pledge.

mix_id.description: The id of the mixnode that will have its pledge updated.

oneOf.description: Request to decrease amount of pledged tokens (by the node operator) from its node.

decrease_by.description: The amount of tokens that should be removed from the pledge.

node_id.description: The id of the nym node that will have its pledge updated.

oneOf.description: Request to decrease amount of pledged tokens (by the node operator) from its node.

decrease_by.description: The amount of tokens that should be removed from the pledge.

mix_id.description: The id of the mixnode that will have its pledge updated.

oneOf.description: Request to unbond a mixnode and completely remove it from the network.

mix_id.description: The id of the mixnode that will get unbonded.

oneOf.description: Request to unbond a nym node and completely remove it from the network.

node_id.description: The id of the node that will get unbonded.

oneOf.description: Request to update the current active set.
